Description: Wheelmade ceramic beaker with simple direct rim, straight sides, and angled lower body to flat base. Pink-grey Aswan fabric. Very eroded; rim chipped and base worn. Painted frieze demarcated by two black painted lines below rim and two above angle of lower body; within, black and red painted degraded lotus flowers in a repeating pattern.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 19) (Type A17)
